page.title: 14THORNBURY CHURCH
page.content: Thornbury Church is a pretty small place. It was founded round about the year 1100 to 1200. It has a Norman doorway. It also has a pound where animals were put if they were found wandering about. If they wanted them back they had to pay a fine. There is the tomb of Sir John and Lady Specott who left a large sum of money for the church and village. They have four children, one at each corner of the tomb. Two of them are holding a skull which means that they died young. The other two are carrying Bibles. There are 5 bells which are in the tower. It also has a small organ which is not powered by electricity. It is air pumped.
